title: Man Dies Of Hunger In Jharkhand, Officials Cover Up By Saying That It's Due To Illness
text:
Man Dies Of Hunger In Jharkhand, Officials Cover Up By Saying That It's Due To Illness

Man Dies Of Hunger In Jharkhand, Officials Cover Up By Saying That It's Due To Illness

In yet another incident of death by starvation, the wife of a 40-year-old man, who did not have a ration card, claimed that her husband died of hunger in Jharkhand's Ramgarh district. Rajendra Birhor, belonging to the primitive Birhor tribe, died yesterday at Nawadih village in Mandu block, 20 km from here. However, district officials denied it, saying his death was due to "illness".

Birhor’s wife, Shanti Devi, said that her husband was suffering from jaundice and the family had no money to buy food and medicines.

Representational Image

Devi said that the family did not even have a ration card to buy food grain at subsidised prices. A father of six children, Birhor was the only earning member of his family. He was recently admitted to the Rajendra Institute of Medical Sciences here but was discharged following treatment.

The Mandu block development officer (BDO), Manoj Kumar Gupta, who visited Birhor's house yesterday, denied that the tribal man died of starvation. He claimed that Birhor died of illness.

The BDO, however, admitted that the family did not have a ration card. He gave Devi food grains and Rs 10,000 to the family.

"We are looking into why the family was not enlisted to avail subsidised ration being provided by the government," he said.

With Inputs From PTI
